alert.note: Alert for Northeast Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued December 13 at 4:55AM AKST until December 13 at 1:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM AKST THIS AFTERNOON FOR THOMPSON PASS... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 50 below zero. * WHERE...Thompson Pass. * WHEN...Until 1 PM AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Northeasterly winds of 35 to 50 mph will continue this morning before diminishing by early afternoon. The combination of strong winds and temperatures falling to between 5 and 15 below zero will keep wind chill values between 40 and 50 below zero through Thompson Pass. As the winds diminish this afternoon, some light snow appears likely. There will still be enough wind to create blowing snow concerns, so motorists should use caution and stay aware of the forecast.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
